meanings.def: something that forms a connection between people or groups, such as a feeling of friendship or shared ideas and experiences
examples: the bond that links us
bond between A and B A bond of friendship had been forged between them.
The agreement strengthened the bonds between the two countries.
the special bond between mother and child
Informal language creates a bond between the members of the community.
bond with somebody The students formed strong bonds with each other.
She felt a bond of affection for the other girls.
We try to forge bonds between the different communities.

meanings.def: an agreement by a government or a company to pay you interest on the money you have lent; a document containing this agreement
examples: government bonds
The bonds were redeemed in 2002.
I decided to invest in some government bonds.

meanings.def: a sum of money that is paid as bail
examples: He was released on $5 000 bond.

meanings.def: a legal agreement by which a bank lends you money to buy a house, etc. which you pay back over many years; the sum of money that is lent
examples: to pay off a bond
We had to take out a second bond on the property.
bond rates (= of interest)

meanings.def: the ropes or chains keeping somebody prisoner; anything that stops you from being free to do what you want
examples: to release somebody from their bonds
the bonds of oppression/injustice

meanings.def: a legal written agreement or promise
examples: We entered into a solemn bond.

meanings.def: the way in which two things are joined together
examples: a firm bond between the two surfaces

meanings.def: the way in which atoms are held together in a chemical compound
somebody’s promise can be relied on completely

idioms.def: somebody’s promise can be relied on completely

meanings.def: to join two things strongly together; to join strongly to something else
examples: bond something This new glue bonds a variety of surfaces in seconds.
bond (A) to B It cannot be used to bond wood to metal.
bond (A and B) together The atoms bond together to form a molecule.

meanings.def: to develop or create a relationship of trust with somebody
examples: Mothers who are depressed sometimes fail to bond with their children.
